results.title: A Visual heritage
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, CBS, Coast Community Colleges, Holt, Rinehart and Winston and KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Traces the highlights of the history of photography. Includes the pioneering work of Louis Daguerre and Nicephore Niepce which enabled the world to see itself objectively for the first time. This program features a number of historical photographs and a discussion of early photography by experts in the field.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sandra Ostertag, CBS, Coast Community Colleges, Holt, Rinehart and Winston and KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.)

results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, CBS, Coast Community Colleges, Holt, Rinehart and Winston and KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Introduces the philosophy of this 20 part course which previews program guests and concepts to be taught over the series. Photographic vision is seen as a means of personal growth and individual expression.

results.title: Video tech
results.creator_credit: Lynn John, John A. Givins and KTV Productions
results.brief_description: This series presented by Jay Laga’aia investigates the magic of TV and how it works. It provides practical advice on how people are making video stories and the techniques used by the professionals.

results.title: Entertainment storytelling
results.creator_credit: Lynn John, John A. Givins and KTV Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 15 of Series “Video tech”.
This program allows the viewer to consolidate what they have learned in the other episodes of the series and apply these to the production of an entertainment story. Follow the production of an actual story from the initial stages of choosing and developing an idea, researching the background, planning work which has to be done on the shoot, getting the shots needed for the story, shotlisting, and doing an interview through to post-production and the screening of the final product.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lynn John, John A. Givins and KTV Productions

results.title: News story telling: events and issues
results.creator_credit: Lynn John, John A. Givins and KTV Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 14 of Series “Video tech”.
This program allows the viewer to consolidate the lessons of earlier episodes and to apply them to the production of a news story. We follow the actual coverage of a news story from the beginnings of researching and planning the story, to shooting on location and then the final editing and screening.

results.title: Advanced editing
results.creator_credit: Lynn John, John A. Givins and KTV Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “Video tech”.
Focuses on advanced editing principles and the editing suite including the Beatcam editing suite, the S-VHS edit bench, how to assemble and insert edits, the mixing of sound including voice overs, graphics, sound effects and sound mixing.

results.title: First principles of editing
results.creator_credit: Lynn John, John A. Givins and KTV Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Video tech”.
Focuses on basic editing principles - making the decision about what to include in a video story and what to omit. Investigates the reasons it is essential to edit - to eliminate unwanted footage, to compress time and to ultimately make a program more interesting. It also looks at the needs of in-camera editing such as planning a shoot, shooting in sequence and shot duration. It also covers the needs of editing between camcorder and VCR, setting up at home and crash editing.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lynn John, John A. Givins and KTV Productions

It also covers the needs of editing between camcorder and VCR, setting up at home and crash editing.

results.title: On screen direction
results.creator_credit: Lynn John, John A. Givins and KTV Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Video tech”.
This episode examines the process of on-screen direction. It details the technical orchestration of setting up the shoot, camera position, visual sequences needed, actuality shots and the direction of people through constant communication and the defining of roles and functions for all people involved. It also explores the requirements for directing special talent including children and animals, and their special needs.

results.title: Crew roles and responsibilities
results.creator_credit: Lynn John, John A. Givins and KTV Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Video tech”.
This episode focuses on the camera crew - who’s who and how they do their jobs. The size of the video crew depends on the size of the story to be presented, but there are three essential crew members - the presenter, the sound recordist and the camera operator. The role of each of these in the production of a video story is thoroughly examined.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lynn John, John A. Givins and KTV Productions

results.title: Visual story telling
results.creator_credit: Lynn John, John A. Givins and KTV Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Video tech”.
This program presents a structured look at the practice and technique of video story telling. It looks at the sequencing of shots and how they work to advance a story, the planning of shots, the shooting of a sequence and the placement of the camera when shooting. It focusses on continuity and the factors to watch when editing so that shots will flow from one to the other and not seem illogical in the finished product.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lynn John, John A. Givins and KTV Productions
